00027 static HNDLE rpc_conn_master_crate;
00028 static BOOL enable_rpc_slave;
00029 
00030 static BOOL event_ended = FALSE;
00031 static INT last_cycle = 0;
00032 static INT last_event_number = 0;
00033 static INT sent_stop_request = -1;
00034 
00035 struct readout_module rpc_slave_module = {
00036   rpc_slave_init,        // init
00037   NULL,                  // exit
00038   NULL,                  // pre_bor
00039   rpc_slave_bor,         // bor

00048 /* ********************************************************************* */
00049 INT rpc_end_of_cycle(INT index, void *prpc_param[])
00050 {
00051   INT cycle_number = CINT(0);
00052   INT event_number = CINT(1);
00053 
00054   diag_print(2, "Cycle ended: RAM %d, event %d\n", cycle_number, event_number);
00055 
00056   // first send out "fake" zero-length events for those cycles
00057   // where we didn't participate
00058   for(INT fake_evnum=last_event_number+1; fake_evnum < event_number; 
00059       fake_evnum++) 
00060   {
00061     diag_print(2, "Sending fake catch-up event for %d\n", fake_evnum);
00062     char fake_event[sizeof(EVENT_HEADER) + sizeof(BANK_HEADER)];
00063     char *pevent = fake_event + sizeof(EVENT_HEADER);
00064 
00065     rpc_flush_event();
00066     bk_init32(pevent);
00067     bm_compose_event((EVENT_HEADER *) fake_event, equipment[0].info.event_id, 0,
00068                      bk_size(pevent), fake_evnum);
00069     bm_send_event(equipment[0].buffer_handle, fake_event,
00070                     sizeof(fake_event), SYNC);
00071     bm_flush_cache(equipment[0].buffer_handle, SYNC);
00072   }
00073  
00074   event_ended = true;
00075   last_cycle = cycle_number;
00076   last_event_number = event_number;
00077 
00078   return SUCCESS;
00079 }
00080 
00081 /* ********************************************************************* */
00082 INT rpc_slave_init()
00083 {
00084   // register the RPC function that we provide
00085   rpc_register_functions(rpc_list_mucap, NULL);
00086   rpc_register_function(RPC_END_OF_CYCLE, rpc_end_of_cycle);
00087 
00088   return SUCCESS;
00089 }

00091 /* ********************************************************************* */
00092 INT rpc_slave_bor()
00093 {
00094   event_ended = FALSE;
00095   last_event_number = 0;
00096   sent_stop_request = -1;
00097   last_cycle = 0;
00098 
00099   // find the master crate
00100   int master_crate = -1;
00101   for(int i = 0; i < MAX_CRATES; i++) {
00102     if(odb_find_key("/Equipment/Crate %d", i) != NULL) {
00103       BOOL master = odb_get_bool("/Equipment/Crate %d/Settings/Master", i);
00104       if(master) master_crate = i;
00105     }
00106   }
00107 
00108   // maybe we're the master...in that case, disable slave function
00109   if(master_crate == crate_number) {
00110     enable_rpc_slave = FALSE;
00111     diag_print(1, "Disabling RPC slave function\n");
00112     return SUCCESS;
00113   } else {
00114     enable_rpc_slave = TRUE;
00115     diag_print(1, "Enabling RPC slave function\n");
00116   }
00117 
00118   // return error if unable to find the master crate
00119         printf("looking for master crate ...\n");
00120   if(master_crate < 0) {
00121                 printf("no master found\n");
00122     diag_print(0, "Unable to locate master crate\n");
00123     return FE_ERR_HW;
00124   }
00125   diag_print(1, "Found master crate %d\n", master_crate);
00126         printf("Master :%d\n", master_crate);
00127 
00128   // establish RPC connections to the master crate
00129   char master_crate_label[10];
00130   sprintf(master_crate_label, "Crate %d", master_crate);
00131 
00132   cm_connect_client(master_crate_label, &rpc_conn_master_crate);
00133   rpc_set_option(rpc_conn_master_crate, RPC_OTRANSPORT, RPC_FTCP);
00134   rpc_set_option(rpc_conn_master_crate, RPC_NODELAY, TRUE);
00135 
00136   send_ready_for_cycle();
00137 
00138   return SUCCESS;
00139 }
00140 
00141 /* ********************************************************************* */
00142 INT rpc_slave_eor()
00143 {
00144   if(enable_rpc_slave) {
00145     cm_disconnect_client(rpc_conn_master_crate, 0);
00146   }
00147   return SUCCESS;
00148 }
00149 
00150 /* ********************************************************************* */
00151 INT rpc_slave_poll_live()
00152 {
00153   if(!enable_rpc_slave) {
00154     return SUCCESS;
00155   }
00156 
00157   // Yield to receive any pending RPCs
00158   cm_yield(1000);
00159 
00160   // Have we received an end-of-event notice?
00161   if(event_ended) {
00162     event_ended = FALSE;
00163     diag_print(2, "event ended\n");
00164     return FE_END_BLOCK;
00165   } else {
00166     return SUCCESS;
00167   }
00168 }
00169 
00170 /* ********************************************************************* */
00171 INT rpc_slave_poll_dead()
00172 {
00173   if(!enable_rpc_slave) {
00174     return SUCCESS;
00175   }
00176 
00177   return FE_NEED_START;
00178 }
00179 
00180 /* ********************************************************************* */
00181 INT rpc_slave_stop_block()
00182 {
00183   if(!enable_rpc_slave) {
00184     return SUCCESS;
00185   }
00186 
00187   int event_number = last_event_number + 1;
00188 
00189   // Send a request to the master crate for the block to end.
00190   if(sent_stop_request < event_number) {
00191     rpc_client_call(rpc_conn_master_crate, RPC_REQUEST_STOP, crate_number, 
00192       event_number);
00193     sent_stop_request = event_number;
00194   }
00195 
00196   return SUCCESS;
00197 }
00198 
00199 /* ********************************************************************* */
00200 INT rpc_slave_read(char *pevent)
00201 {
00202   if(!enable_rpc_slave) {
00203     return SUCCESS;
00204   }
00205 
00206   // Fill in event number
00207   (((EVENT_HEADER *)pevent)-1)->serial_number = last_event_number;
00208 
00209   // Announce that we're ready for the next cycle
00210 
00211   send_ready_for_cycle();
00212 
00213   return SUCCESS;
00214 }
00215 
00216 /* ********************************************************************* */
00217 INT send_ready_for_cycle()
00218 {
00219   // Send "ready to go"
00220   struct timeval tv1, tv2;
00221   gettimeofday(&tv1, NULL);
00222   rpc_client_call(rpc_conn_master_crate, RPC_READY_FOR_CYCLE, crate_number, 0); 
00223   gettimeofday(&tv2, NULL);
00224 
00225   diag_print(2, "Waited %f microseconds for RPC_READY_FOR_CYCLE.\n",
00226     (tv2.tv_sec-tv1.tv_sec)*1e6 + (tv2.tv_usec-tv1.tv_usec));
00227    
00228   return SUCCESS;
00229 }
